text: Princeton Nathan Lyman (November 20, 1935 – August 24, 2018) was an American diplomat. He was born in San Francisco, California. He was the United States Ambassador to Nigeria (1986–89) and South Africa (1992–95), and former Assistant Secretary of State for International Organization Affairs (1996–98Council on Foreign Relations biography Retrieved 2010-01-12.). Lyman died of lung cancer on August 24, 2018 in Silver Spring, Maryland, aged 82.Princeton Lyman, U.S. ambassador who helped guide South Africa out of apartheid, dies at 82 ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:Ambassadors of the United States Category:Politicians from San Francisco
title: Princeton Lyman
